markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 17"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Armbands of the Gorgon](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2133)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Apex" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=10" />
<trait label="Invested" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=98" />
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=103" />
<trait label="Transmutation" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=157" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Treasure Vault](/Sources.aspx?ID=191) pg. 102 <sup>1.1</sup></row>

**Price** 15,000 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** worn armbands

**Bulk** L
</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

Each of these shining, bluish-gray metal armbands is adorned with the plated visage of a [gorgon's](/Monsters.aspx?ID=686) head. When targeted by a spell or effect with the [incapacitation](/Traits.aspx?ID=93) effect, you treat the result of your save as if it were one degree of success better, and the result of any check made to inflict such an effect on you as one degree of success worse (as if you were more than twice the level of the spell or effect targeting you). When you invest the armbands, you either increase your Constitution score by 2 or increase it to 18, whichever is higher.

<document level="2" id="action-1624" />

<column gap="tiny">

</column>
name: Armbands of the Gorgon

When targeted by a spell or effect with the incapacitation effect, you treat the result of your save as if it were one degree of success better, and the result of any check made to inflict such an effect on you as one degree of success worse (as if you were more than twice the level of the spell or effect targeting you). When you invest the armbands, you either increase your Constitution score by 2 or increase it to 18, whichever is higher.
